climbs.name: The Prow
climbs.fa: Rand Swanson, Meg Hall, Pat Callis, 1994

content.description: This climb ascends the right most bolt line on this wall.  It has variable climbing through several steep sections with some bold sections.  Approach via the right bolt line after getting to the base.  This will lead to a belay anchor on a small ledge right before you punch out of the sill and onto the limestone.  The climb is rather dirty for its first 25 feet of the second pitch.  Continue up to a small roof and surmount it to the left.  The roof pull feels much harder than 5.10a with loose rock for your feet and terrible handholds.
content.location: Right of Chips ascends the edge of the large dihedral.

climbs.name: Gallatin Swing
climbs.fa: Ben Reuter and Neige Calonne, Nov 2018

content.description:
Two pitches on good limestone equipped with stainless steel anchors. Additional gear recommended. Great views, technical moves and plenty of air make it a worthwhile climb.

Pitch 1: 5.11a, 28 m, 6 bolts; follow a short cracked buttress (.4″), then climb up a dihedral and into a steep face to the anchors.

Pitch 2: 5.11a, 30 m, 4 bolts; traverse right, climb a short buttress along its edge, then follow a crack (.4″ – .75″) and finish on a vertical face.

Descent: Anchors equipped for two 30 m rappels, works out with a 60 m single rope.
content.protection: Stainless steel anchors. Additional gear recommended.

climbs.name: Chips
climbs.fa: Meg Hall, Rand Swanson, Mike Kehoe, Clair Monot, Cindy Austiguy. 90's

content.description:
This line ascends the middle of the formation skirting the roof on the right side.

Pitch 1 (5.4)

Ascend through the blocky chunks of the sill taking the lefter of the two bolt lines.  Easy but beware of LARGE death blocks.  2 bolt anchor with chains.

Pitch 2 (5.9+)

Climb up and slightly right from the chains following the right line of bolts where they diverge.  Pull through a small roof (crux) and then continue up onto the slab above.  Very balancy.  Finishes on small ledge with chain anchors.

Pitch 3 (5.8)

Head up and follow the bolt line for another 40 or so feet until you reach another small ledge with a chain anchor.

If you have a tolerance for rope drag and healthy sense of when to sling things you can do the entire climb in one long 60-70 meter pitch.  Requires 21 quickdraws and anchoring equipment.

Descent

A 70 meter rope can just BARELY make it to the 1st set of anchors from the third.  Tie knots in the ends as the fall would surely kill if someone rapped off the ends.  From there thread the 1st anchor and aim for the ground.
content.location: The middle climb on the wall this ascends just to the left of a large (>20 ft) left facing dihedral.
